meanings.definition: To give new energy or strength to
meanings.sent1: She reinvigorated her garden by planting colorful flowers.
meanings.sent2: The coach's pep talk reinvigorated the team before the game.
meanings.sent3: The tired puppy found reinvigoration in chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The rain reinvigorated the dry earth, bringing life to the plants.
meanings.sent5: The fresh air and sunshine reinvigorated her after a long day at work.

meanings.definition: The act of revitalizing or refreshing
meanings.sent1: The reinvigoration of the old building brought new life to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: After a long hike, the cool stream provided a much-needed reinvigoration.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected snowfall was a delightful reinvigoration for the children.
meanings.sent4: The music festival was a reinvigoration of the town's cultural scene.
meanings.sent5: The spa offered a luxurious reinvigoration for its guests.

meanings.sent1: His face showed the reinvigoration he felt after a good night's sleep.
meanings.sent2: The reinvigoration of the forest after the rain was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent3: The laughter of children brought a sense of reinvigoration to the park.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise symbolized a new day and reinvigoration for the world.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread baking brought a feeling of reinvigoration to the bakery.
